column4: hi guys, i just installed new nvidia driverse (180.11) and i'm experiencing some color loss
for example, i can see stripes on my background etc...
does anyone know what could be the problem?
yes.. i have 3d acceleration
it's like 16bit colors
geforce go 7300
look here under driver version section if your card is soupported by binary drivers ! !  https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BinaryDriverHowto/Nvidia
look here under driver version section if your card is soupported by binary drivers ! !  https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BinaryDriverHowto/Nvidia
what do you want exactly?
i installed new drivers (180.11) and i'm experiencing some colors loss.. i can see stripes on my background and cube reflection ground....
okay but so why didnt you use the regular drivers?
what regular drivers?
look here under driver version section if your card is soupported by binary drivers ! !  https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BinaryDriverHowto/Nvidia
posted this line 3rd time now
i've seen that link but there is no information for 180.11 driver... although i think my card is supported because i have 3d acceleration
well but the driver is not soupported by ubuntu directly isn't it? also envy should not soupport it
well that is the problem i dont know if it is supported directly by ubuntu :D

and if you read up nvidia forum you will see, installing anything else could be a very hard problem... so you have to do the work for your own and post in that forum an into other forums... because the problem gets bigger than can be discussed here, i souppose
you should use the driver mentioned on the link i gave you... and the problems are easier

you said you are useing ubuntu 8.10 => so there you can activate hardware driver ... if you updated from 8.04 you may expact many problems... that may lead you to envy ( to clean up old installations)
yes newer driver => no full use under linux... think about this! and use the oldone
read up nvidia forums on linux soupport ....
